label: Description
value: Printed in black, yellow and pale blue on dark blue ground, with scalloped scroll and floral sprays.

label: Description
value: Portion of a cartouche outlined in pink and violet, set with pink and green arrow heads; to right and left, trailing flower garlands, blanked by floral sprays. The register of the printing is not accurate, and varies in the two pieces. The paper is light brown, of coarse texture. -a was formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Design in black and white: a diagonal lattice of bead shapes enclosing squares set alternatively with vertical black and horizontal white lines, with central leaf motif flanked left and right by vertical rows of black and white crowns. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Alternating vertical serpentine foliate bands enclosing irregular ellipses, each set with a green flower form surrounded by a circle of green dots. Border present along right edge. Original colors appear along edges, where paper has been folded. Paper has small threads in it. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Large pattern of leaf clusters in green, overprinted with diagonal cross-strokes in darker green; secondary pattern of pink vine-form. Backed with paper of same design. The paper is light brown, of coarse texture. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Notes
value: Large pattern of leaf clusters in green, overprinted with diagonal cross-strokes in darker green; secondary pattern of pink vine-form. Backed with paper of same design. The paper is light brown, of coarse texture. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Lozenge framework formed of foliate scrolls, with small beaded circular motif at points of intersection, enclosing elliptical paterae. Formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Border design, possibly from a roll of paper. Checkered band of lighter and darker green lozenges, flanked left and right by green stripes; to left, white double chevrons enclosed between white stripes. At left, original margin of paper. Original colors appear along edges, where paper has been folded. Printed in green and white on blue-gray ground.

label: Description
value: Shaped squarish figures form a checker board or diamond trellis pattern, enclosing a simple floral form on dotted ground, which alternates with floral sprays. At left, original margin of paper. Original colors appear along edges, where paper has been folded. Paper is gray and coarse; green colors have high gloss. This wallpaper was formerly used as a book cover.

label: Description
value: Ivory plain cloth ground with black silk secondary weft forming portrait of Columbus. Crossed flags of United States and Spain and the inscription: "Columbus" below portrait (b) at bottom in color: "Souvenir of the Discovery of America." At top, scene in black and ivory with the inscription: Landing of Columbus Oct 12th 1492.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth with supplementary weft

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 15 x 6.5 cm (5 7/8 x 2 9/16 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 2.7 x 6.5 cm (1 1/16 x 2 9/16 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Given by Mrs. Henry Cole Quinby

label: Description
value: Fragment of silk with white horizontally ribbed ground brocaded in blue, orange and pink silk. Design of lace-like serpentines and large foliage  with flowers. Selvage present.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound weave with supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Provenance
value: Pre-1938: Mrs. I. N. Phelps Stokes collection; 1938: acquired by the Museum.

label: Description
value: Two fragments of very fine tapestry weave with cotton warps and wool wefts. A) Face of a man or god, conventionalized and angular in blue, red, tan, black and brown.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: slit and single interlocked tapestry

label: Description
value: Two fragments of very fine tapestry weave with cotton warps and wool wefts. B) Lozenge repeat in eccentric tapestry in red, blue, black, brown and tan.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: interlocked tapestry, minor use of non-horizontal wefts

label: Description
value: Vertical band divided into six pattern areas.  Alternating repeat of an altar with two animals, and a man with an elaborate headdress.  In brown, tan, yellow, red, black, white, and blue.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: slit tapestry

label: Description
value: Red ground with geometric design in blue, black, white, yellow and tan.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool Technique: discontinuous and interlocked warps and wefts

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase from Friends of the Museum Fund

label: Description
value: Fragment of a funerary mantle in light brown cotton plain cloth ground (doubled warps) with figure of a man brocaded in yellow, red, brown, orange and tan.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Fragment of a funerary mantle in light brown cotton plain cloth ground (paired warps) with figure of a man brocaded in yellow, red, and brown wools

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)

label: Description
value: Brown cotton plain cloth with two fish brocaded in wool. One fish is brown and red, the other red and yellow.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: plain weave with discontinuous supplementary weft patterning (brocade)
Fantastic Flower Motif from Nouvelle Suitte de Cahiers de Fleurs Idéales

label: Description
value: A branch with flower buds and feather-like leaves. The etching lines are colored in purple, ochre, blue-green, teal and pink, varying in density and tone throughout.

label: Physical description
value: Etching a la poupée in colored inks on paper
Fantastic Flower Motif from Nouvelle Suitte de Cahiers de Fleurs Idéales

label: Description
value: An imagined flower arrangement - pennant-like leaves with small flowers emerge from stems at a diagonal within the composition. Below, smaller botanicals comprised of leaves and blossoms resemble peacock feathers. Etched lines articulated in teal, pink, purple, and ochre.

label: Physical description
value: Etching a la poupée and colored inks on paper
A Street Scene in Madrid, from Series "Sketches in Madrid"

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. A male officer in dress uniform at left with a Spanish noblewoman and her lady-in-waiting. The noblewoman is wearing a black lace mantilla. All figures viewed from back. Additional groups of figures in the background, steps from a terrace lead to a garden.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and blue, pink, brown wash on paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum
Two Studies of the Artist's Son Charlie

label: Description
value: Studies for painting of Chocorua. Two sketches of the artist's son, Charlie, sitting on the ground with a rifle. Above, he lays, facing away from the viewer, supported by his left elbow. Below, he sits facing right, his hands resting on his ankles. Verso: Two studies of the Catskill Mountains.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on buff wove paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle with trimmed corners. Figure of a woman, side view, facing right, wearing a poke bonnet and shawl and carrying a muff. She is talking with a gentleman seen in three quarter front view wearing a high hat, light trousers, cutaway coat and carrying a cane.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and tan and blue washes over graphite on thin white wove paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Sketch of a brook with trees and a meadow in the background.

label: Provenance
value: Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: A rocky shore, with small breakers.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. At right, a woman, seen in three quarter view from front, with black curly hair wearing a low-necked yellow blouse and an orange skirt. At left, an elderly gentleman wearing gloves, seen in three quarter view from back, bowing to the woman. Handwritten inscription below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and watercolor on bristol board

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum
Albert Gallatin, Two Left Hand Studies

label: Description
value: Two studies of left hands, one on top of the other, with the page divided by a line.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on grey wove paper
Albert Gallatin Seated, Study of Right Hand

label: Description
value: Study of a seated figure with his left hand on an open book. Additional study of his right hand, upper left.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on blue-grey wove paper

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Standing figure of a woman, turned toward left. She wears a small hat and an elaborate colorful dress with a bustle and large bow.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, tempera, pen and ink on bristol board

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum
La dame au châle (Lady in a Shawl)

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle, bevelled corners. Figure of a woman outside walking, facing three quarter view front, wearing a poke bonnet with blue ribbons, a black velvet three quarter coat edged with fringe, a grayish lavender skirt, and carrying a brown fur muff.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and brown ink, brush and purple, tan, and blue wash, graphite on white paper

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Seated male figure with glasses. Three-quarter view, facing towards left. Verso: Arm studies.

label: Description
value: Three-quarter view of male figure, seated in armchair, with papers in right hand. Facing towards left.

label: Description
value: Three-quarter view of man seated, facing left, with left arm more developed than right. Verso: Man's hand holding book on lap, with upper leg of man.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on green-grey paper Verso: Graphite, white chalk on green-grey paper
Study for a Portrait of Albert Gallatin, Seated

label: Description
value: Man with head turned to the left, seated at a table, with his arm resting on papers. Verso: Study of a woman's right hand.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite on gray-green wove paper, with white heightening on verso
President Chester A. Arthur, Standing, with Separate Head, Shoulder, and Arm Study

label: Description
value: Standing male figure with right hand raised and left arm at side, gazing upward toward right. Additional studies of right arm, head and shoulder. Verso: Three foot studies.
Two Studies of Daniel Huntington for "The Atlantic Cable Projectors"

label: Description
value: Self-portrait of the artist leaning forward towards a table, his gaze turned downward.  His left forearm rests on the back of a chair, while his right hand lifts papers on the table. Additional studies of head and left hand, at right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on blue-green wove paper
Carl Schurz Seated, Reading a Newspaper

label: Description
value: Three-quarter portrait of a seated male figure wearing spectacles. His left hand rests onthe arm of a chair, and his right hand holds a newspaper. Facing left, with head turned toward right.

label: Physical description
value: Graphite, white chalk on grey wove paper

label: Description
value: Portrait of a seated man with a beard and pince nez glasses, holding a paper in his right hand. Verso: Portrait of a seated man.

label: Description
value: Three-quarter length seated male figure turned toward left, facing frontally, wearing glasses. More shading on face, with body outlined.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. Two figures engaged in conversation. Woman at right in a hat with red and green trimming, wearing a yellow blouse and black bloomers, is being addressed by a man in Directoire costume with a long red nose. Pen and ink transcription below.

label: Physical description
value: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on bristol board

label: Provenance
value: Sarah Cooper Hewitt, Erskine Hewitt, New York, NY; 1938: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Standing portrait of Chester A. Arthur with left arm at side and right elbow resting on a ledge or mantel.
